headline: The possibilities for dark matter have just shrunk — by a lot
context: The LZ experiment reports no signs of dark matter in their latest search
The LZ experiment is designed to detect light from interactions of dark matter particles using photomultiplier tubes (shown).

annotations.reason: This is an image credit and does not contribute to the article's core story.

annotations.paragraph: Scientists have just slashed the potential hiding spaces for dark matter particles.
annotations.reason: This sentence provides a summary of the main finding related to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: The LUX-ZEPLIN, or LZ, experiment has searched for and ruled out the existence of dark matter particles with a wide swath of properties, researchers report August 26 at two conferences.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific details about the LZ experiment's findings, directly related to the headline.
